newsitem.title: USA: Amoco signs Dutch national gas contracts.
newsitem.headline: Amoco signs Dutch national gas contracts.

text.p: Amoco Corp said Thursday it extended its involvement in the Dutch downstream gas market with the formal signing of contracts with the Dutch national gas transmission and distribution company, Gasunie.

The contracts, signed by Amoco Netherlands B.V. and its partners - Veba Oil Nederland B.V., Dyas B.V. and Energie Beheer Nederland B.V. - relate to the conversion of a largely depleted Amoco-operated gas field in North Holland for underground gas storage.
The Amoco-operated facility will store and deliver natural gas into the Dutch national transmission system operated by Gasunie to meet increased demand during the winter months.
It is scheduled to be available in time for the 1997-98 peak winter season.

The Peak Gas Installation project is one of the first underground gas storage projects to be built in the Netherlands. Announced last year, it is estimated to cost about US$191 million and will provide up to 24 million cubic meters of gas per day, for short periods. It will have an annual working capacity of 250 million cubic meters.

Amoco Netherlands B.V. has been in the Netherlands for 30 years and is operator of the offshore Rijn field, P15/18 gas field, as well as gas fields onshore in the Bergen Concession area. The company is a subsidiary of Amoco Corp, a global producer and marketer of oil, natural gas, petroluem products and petrochemicals.
